title: Protocol for isolation of spermatids from mouse testes
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
Sacrifice mice
Timing: ~30 min
The steps include preparation of testes from mice.
Sacrifice mice using isoflurane inhalation in the closed chamber and open the lower abdomen using surgical scissors (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]A).
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/362-Fig2.jpg
Figure 2. Preparation of mouse testes
(A) View of mouse with opening at the lower abdomen on the dissection tray. Arrows indicate epididymal fat.
(B) Pulling epididymal fat can expose testes and epididymis. Arrow indicates testis.
(C) Removal of epididymal fat and epididymis around testes.
(D) Removal of tunica albuginea. Arrow indicates tunica albuginea of testis.
Expose testes by pulling epididymal fat and remove fat and epididymis around testes (Figures 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]B and 2C).
Transfer testes to cold DPBS, and wash blood. Then, remove the tunica albuginea of testes (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]D).
Transfer the tunica albuginea-removed testes to digestion media I (10 mL).
Preparation of single-cell suspension of testes (testicular cells)
Timing: ~100 min
The steps exhibit dissociation of testes using enzymes to get single-cell suspension of testes (testicular cells).
Primary digestion is performed at 37°C (Figure 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3]A).
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/362-Fig3.jpg
Figure 3. Digestion of mouse testes
(A) The left image shows decapitulated testes in digestion media I. In 15 min, seminiferous tubules of testes are dissociated (right).
(B) Digested product poured over 5% Percoll solution is separated by gravity (left). In 20 min, high density seminiferous tubules sink to the bottom (right).
(C) Secondary digestion results in single-cell suspension from seminiferous tubules.
Following incubation for 5 min, dissociate testes thorough pipetting.
Incubate for 15 min further. Then, gently pipette until seminiferous tubules are dissociated.
Critical: Seminiferous tubules should be maintained intact. Too much pipetting can result in fragmentation of tubules.

Load the digested product over the top of 5% Percoll solution (40 mL) at 20°C–25°C. In 20 min, while the majority of interstitial cells are distributed at the top of the solution, highly dense seminiferous tubules sink at the bottom (Figure 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3]B).
Remove 35 mL of supernatant and transfer 5 mL of bottom including seminiferous tubules to digestion media II (10 mL).
Secondary digestion is performed for 20 min at 37°C. Carefully pipette until seminiferous tubules disappear (Figure 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3]C).
Add FBS 3 mL to neutralize trypsin.
Critical: Digestion for a long time can cause cell aggregation (see Troubleshooting 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#troubleshooting]).
The digested product is filtered through a 70 μm cell strainer and 40 μm cell strainer sequentially.
Centrifuge filtered cell suspension with 500 × g at 4°C for 10 min.
Pipette cell pellet with HBSS (1×) 1 mL and centrifuge it with 500 × g at 4°C for 2 min. Pipette cell pellet with RBC lysis buffer (1×, dilution with distilled water) 1 mL and incubate at 4°C for 1 min. Then, centrifuge it with 500 × g at 4°C for 2 min.
Critical: Keep the time for this step. Too long time for RBC lysis can damage testicular cells.
Pipette cells with HBSS (1×) 1 mL and then centrifuge with 500 × g at 4°C for 2 min.
Pipette cells with 1 mL of 0.5% BSA.
Unit gravity sedimentation in BSA density gradient
Timing: ~4 h
Through these steps, 20 fractions of testicular cells are collected.
Load testicular cells in 1 mL of 0.5% BSA to the wall of column slowly over 0.5% BSA using serological pipettes (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]D).
Stand for 150 min at 20°C–25°C.
Open the valve at the bottom of column so that the flow rate is 2 mL/min.
Collect fractions per 4 mL.

Centrifuge all fractions with 1,000 × g at 4°C for 10 min.
Discard supernatant and pipette cell pellets with HBSS (1×) 1 mL.
Observe cells in each fraction with a microscope.
Following centrifugation with 1,000 × g at 4°C for 3 min, store cell pellet at −80°C.
